name: Fake Amazon iPhone Deal
description: Scammer sends a phishing email impersonating Amazon with a fake iPhone 15 Pro deal at Rs. 999, using a lookalike domain to steal credentials and payment information.

turns.scammer_message: You have been selected for iPhone 15 Pro at just Rs. 999! Click here to claim: http://amaz0n-deals.fake-site.com/claim?id=12345. Offer expires in 10 minutes!
turns.notes: Initial phishing bait with fake Amazon deal link containing lookalike domain (amaz0n with zero).

turns.scammer_message: Dear valued customer, we noticed you haven't claimed your iPhone 15 Pro yet. This is a verified Amazon offer sent from our official promotions team. For any queries, reach us at offers@fake-amazon-deals.com. Hurry, only 3 units remaining!
turns.notes: Scammer shares fake email address posing as Amazon support to build credibility.

turns.scammer_message: We are extending the offer just for you! Click http://amaz0n-deals.fake-site.com/claim?id=12345 to complete your purchase. Pay only Rs. 999 and get free delivery. This link is secure and encrypted by Amazon Pay.
turns.notes: Scammer resends the phishing link with false claims about encryption and security.

turns.scammer_message: Final reminder from Amazon Deals Team. Your reserved iPhone 15 Pro will be released to another customer in 5 minutes. If you face any issues with the link, email us directly at offers@fake-amazon-deals.com and we will send you a direct checkout page.
turns.notes: Scammer shares email again as an alternative channel, creating urgency with countdown.

turns.scammer_message: LAST CHANCE! Your iPhone 15 Pro reservation at Rs. 999 expires NOW. After this, the price goes back to Rs. 1,49,900. Don't miss out â€” this was a once-in-a-lifetime deal! We cannot extend this any further.
turns.notes: Final urgency pressure without new intelligence, trying to force immediate action.
